paper_abstract: Consider the complete n-vertex graph whose edge-lengths are independent exponentially distributed random variables. Simultaneously for each pair of vertices, put a constant flow between them along the shortest path. Each edge gets some random total flow. In the n -> infinity limit we find explicitly the empirical distribution of these edge-flows, suitably normalized. (C) 2010 Wiley Periodicals. Inc. Random Struct. Alg., 37, 271-311, 2010
paper_title: Edge Flows in the Complete Random-Lengths Network
